titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to repeal limitations on the eligibility of dependents of civilian employees of the Federal Government residing in a territory, commonwealth, or possession of the United States to enroll in Department of Defense domestic dependent elementary and secondary schools.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Readiness.

bill.summary: 4/9/2002--Introduced. Allows a dependent of a Federal employee who is enrolled in an educational program provided by the Secretary of Defense in a U.S. territory, commonwealth, or possession and who is not residing on a military installation to continue such enrollment until the dependent's graduation (currently limited to five consecutive school years).Repeals the requirement that the Secretary be reimbursed by the appropriate agency head for education so provided to a dependent of an employee of a Federal agency outside the Department of Defense.
